snippet: An apparent Taliban suicide attack in a tribal district along the Afghan border killed 26 people and wounded 75, hospital and government officials said.
abstract: Suicide bomber attacks government checkpoint in Pakistan, killing at least 26 people and wounding 75 others; Pakistani Taliban takes credit for attack, saying it was retaliation for death of Sheik Marwan, Qaeda commander killed by security forces in 2011.

byline.original: By ISMAIL KHAN and DECLAN WALSH
byline.contributor: Ismail Khan reported from Peshawar, and Declan Walsh from Islamabad, Pakistan. Ihsanullah Tipu Mehsud contributed reporting from Islamabad.

lead_paragraph: An apparent Taliban suicide attack in a tribal district along the Afghan border killed 26 people and wounded 75, hospital and government officials said.

headline.seo: Suicide Attack in Khar, Pakistan, Kills at Least 26
headline.main: Suicide Bomber Attacks Market in Pakistan, Killing at Least 26
headline.print_headline: Suicide Bomber Attacks Market in Pakistan, Killing at Least 26
